Description: Glazed composition scarab; underside engraved with Athena Promachos, wearing a crested helmet and snake-fringed aegis, holding a shield and spear; turquoise blue glaze well preserved.
Curator's comments: Boardman attributes this to the 'Group of the Leningrad Gorgon'. Since the seal was purchased in 1870, it is very unlikely that it comes from Naukratis. Boardman 1968, Archaic Greek gems, London, 91, Pl. XV, no. 245.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (315*)
Boardman 1968a / Archaic Greek gems (No. 245, p. 91 & pl. XV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PA.29)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
